SEARCH
Module brickGame
Package brickGame

Class Score

java.lang.Object
brickGame.Score
public class Score extends Object
The Score class provides methods to display score-related messages in the game. It includes methods to show score updates, messages, game over, and victory messages.

HTML Note: The HTML tags can be used for formatting purposes in the generated Javadocs.

Example usage: 

 
 Score score = new Score();
 score.show(x, y, scoreValue, main);
 score.showMessage("Game Over", main);
 score.showGameOver(main);
 score.showWin(main);

  • Method Details

    • show

      public void show(double x, double y, int score, javafx.stage.Stage main)
      Displays the score update at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate for the score display.
      y - The y-coordinate for the score display.
      score - The score value to be displayed.
      main - The main game instance.

      Example usage: 

                    
              score.show(x, y, scoreValue, main);

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String message, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Displays a pop-up message.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be displayed.
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the application.

      Example usage: 

                           
                     new Score().showMessage("Game Saved", main.primaryStage());

    • showGameOver

      public void showGameOver(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, int score)
      Displays the game over message and a restart button.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the JavaFX application.
      score - The final score achieved in the game.

      Example usage: 

                           
                     score.showGameOver(primaryStage);

    • showWin

      public void showWin(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Displays the win message when the player reaches level 5.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the application.

      Example usage: 

                            
                      score.showWin(primaryStage);
